Ann,
 
See I does not hurt to get your feet wet, Pretty soon you'll be swi=
iming laps in the teaching pool 
 
Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yaho=
ogroups.comFrom: lisby@...: Wed, 30 Jan 2008 19:44:39 -0500Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP




Robin, you can do it. It took me ages and =
about $900, but I finally got it all together and its running well. I am a =
technical as an onion. I can't operate the DVD remote without tears. But I =
hung in there--and you must, too. This is a massively rewarding experience =
and I can't wait to see what you get and who you get it from. :) 

Ann


On=
 Jan 30, 2008, at 7:03 PM, Robin Searcy Henson wrote:






Thanks LC.  I'm=
 going to listen to your recordings tonight when I get home.  I'm intrigued=
 by the box research and anxious to get started, but frustrated that I'm no=
t mechanically inclined.  I think you may be onto something with regard to =
people having individual roles to play, and you must feel so inspired by th=
e messages you've received.
 
Robin
 
 

----- Original Message -----
From:=
 LC Duplatt
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, January 30, 2008 6=
:37 AM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP


Robin,I uploaded some of my recordings =
that indicate a bigger picture.Some of the messages say there are "many spi=
rits here," spirit rescue is "very important," etc. You can go through them=
 under LC's folder.Last Friday, I recorded with respect to 2008, "psychic e=
vent" and "universal shift." That would indicate that there is a bigger thi=
ng going down, in my opinion. However, I also acknowledge that people here =
may have different callings/messages/uses other than what I am hearing. I a=
m going to just follow where the path before me leads and try to find my ro=
le in it.Personally, I think this needs to be in many people's hands. That'=
s an interest of mine, too. Not sure yet how it will happen, but the radio =
hacks are a nice start. LC--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Robin Searcy Hen=
son" <MudPuddleFarm@...> wrote:>> I haven't started box recording yet. My i=
mpression of the EVP I've captured (which has been almost entirely obtained=
 on the property I moved to six years ago) is that someone is attached to t=
his place. The first message was "Here come some people," as I was hiking u=
p the hill one day with my goats, then a kill-you threat in the house, then=
 "get out of here" in the barn. I assumed it must be one of the original ow=
ners, and I still feel that it's mainly one spirit communicating that this =
is their home, not mine. I've gotten one uplifting message from what I beli=
eve to be the same entity, and this is also the last recording I've gotten.=
 I asked what death is like, compared to life: happy, beautiful, fulfilling=
--and specifically if death is less depressing. The response was "It's ever=
ything." S/he/it basically stopped talking after that, and I stopped trying=
. I know this sounds weird, but I miss whoever or whatever it was. I wonder=
 if some of us might be better at dealing with the low-life stuck or ground=
ed entities rather than the highly evolved technicians coming through the m=
ore sophisticated equipment. I wonder where this is all going ultimately, o=
ther than to prove communication across the veil is possible. I'm not an en=
gineer or technologist on this physical plane, and I question what I have t=
o offer this research since I'm so electronically challenged. Meanwhile, th=
e nurse side of me wants to heal and "fix" anyone needing help, even if the=
y happen to be in the next world! Do the guides and technicians ever acknow=
ledge or make reference to the earthbound spirits, and if so, in what conte=
xt? Are we ever able to help unstick the stuck ones? Are we supposed to ign=
ore them? > > Robin> > > ----- Original Message ----- > From: LC Duplatt<ma=
ilto:lcdupla@...> > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.=
com> > Sent: Tuesday, January 29, 2008 3:32 AM> Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: EVP>=
 > > EVP:> > Not that this is always the case, but EVP seems to primarily c=
apture > lost people - ghosts being recorded, versus the box having the > a=
bility to capture primarily what seems to be higher communication > from sp=
irits, (and less of the lower communication - ghosts jumping > in).> > That=
 to me is a huge difference... ;)> > LC> http://www.AngelsGhosts.com<http:/=
/www.angelsghosts.com/>> > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40=
yahoogroups.com>, "ecuyler" <ecuyler@> wrote:> >> > I agree about the diffe=
rence also. All that review time makes for a> > very tedious few hours. By =
the end of it you're ready to pull your> > hair out. I've only done two ses=
sions now and have gotten more> > positive results in 20 minutes time as I =
have in 10 years of EVP > research.> > > > Jeremy> > > > > > > > > > > > > =
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com>, Lis=
by <lisby@> wrote:> > >> > > Very interested. And I agree with you about th=
e overnight > change. > > > Orgs like AA-EVP that aren't dealing with the b=
oxes are missing > the > > > boat.> > > > > > Ann> > > > > > On Jan 28, 200=
8, at 8:48 PM, Jules wrote:> > > > > > > Well guys, I have to tell you that=
 since I started box sessions > in> > > > November I have become so spoiled=
 that conventional EVP just > don't do> > > > it for me.> > > >> > > > My o=
rganization was asked to come and do an investigation at a > very> > > > hi=
storial place (here in Illinois). The owner of this home > asked if I> > > =
> would bring one of the boxes to the home (he is amazed with the> > > > im=
mediately 2 way communication). So upon respectfully asking > my tec> > > >=
 if it was alright to do a session outside the my home we did > several> > =
> > box sessions along with conventional EVP. We wanted to see if > we coul=
d> > > > discover some unanswered history about the residence, and the > > =
> > otherside> > > > was more than willing to comply.> > > >> > > > I have =
to tell you that the regular EVP recordings were and are > the> > > > most =
boring data to review. Something I use to love so much has> > > > actually =
turned into a project given I am waiting for a response> > > > immediately!=
 Too funny how things can change overnight!> > > >> > > > I will be uploadi=
ng some files for these sessions if you are > > > > interested.> > > >> > >=
 > Juli> > > >> > > >> > > >> > >> >>
